title: the coat
body:
After the Mighty Nein reunited at Mollymauk’s grave, after Yasha left to burn her anger out among the northern storms, but before the rest of the group continued onto Zedash, six strips of fabric were cut from the bottom of Molly’s coat.

Fjord wrapped the embroidered hemline, the symbol of the Dawnfather repeated ad infinitum, around the hilt of the Summer’s Dance, a tactile reminder of what his carelessness caused. 

Beau used her scrap, a line of arcane gibberish and beaded flames, to tie her hair back during the day. Sometimes at night, when she takes her hair down, she runs her thumb over the beaded designs and shuffles Molly’s cards with her other hand, trying to figure out how to leave the world better than she finds it.

Caleb chose a quilted section of the coat to tuck into his spellbook, next to his notes on temporal manipulation and fire is an inch-wide strip of quilted gold and red flames, purple bleeding in along the edges. “There’s time for that later” is scrawled in hasty Zemnian across the top of the adjacent page, a reminder of his greater goals.

Nott tucked her scrap into her component pouch, the embroidered images of fantastical beasts are heavily beaded and her strip of fabric has the highest button to cloth ratio of any other member. Now, whenever she starts to cast Disguise Self or Mage Hand, her hand brushes against the fabric and reminds her not to steal from happy people.

Jester’s strip of Molly’s coat looks like a rainbow in old cotton. Reds, and oranges, pinks, blues, and greens twist around her left horn in a giant bow, a row of delicately embroidered moons dancing across the entire strip. Everyday she is reminded of the fortune he shared and the joy for life her fellow tiefling held within him.

Caduceus didn’t know Molly, but he knew mourning and he understood that the woman with wings of lightning and bone was mourning deeply when she left. He cut a small strip from the coat when no one was looking, bright colors with a pair of dancing swords and golden sun, and he tucked it into his gear until Yasha returned. He found a kindred spirit in Yasha during their first night on the Mistake, both eager to do as their gods commanded, but confused at the current paths of their lives. It was during this night, as the sky reached its darkest that Caduceus offered to braid her hair, incorporating the strip of fabric into the braid, so that she could keep a reminder of her friend with her always.

After the Mighty Nein reunited at Mollymauk’s grave, after Yasha left to burn her anger out among the northern storms, but before the rest of the group continued onto Zedash, six strips of fabric were cut from the bottom of Molly’s coat.

Fjord wrapped the embroidered hemline, the symbol of the Dawnfather repeated ad infinitum, around the hilt of the Summer’s Dance, a tactile reminder of what his carelessness caused. 

Beau used her scrap, a line of arcane gibberish and beaded flames, to tie her hair back during the day. Sometimes at night, when she takes her hair down, she runs her thumb over the beaded designs and shuffles Molly’s cards with her other hand, trying to figure out how to leave the world better than she finds it.

Caleb chose a quilted section of the coat to tuck into his spellbook, next to his notes on temporal manipulation and fire is an inch-wide strip of quilted gold and red flames, purple bleeding in along the edges. “There’s time for that later” is scrawled in hasty Zemnian across the top of the adjacent page, a reminder of his greater goals.

Nott tucked her scrap into her component pouch, the embroidered images of fantastical beasts are heavily beaded and her strip of fabric has the highest button to cloth ratio of any other member. Now, whenever she starts to cast Disguise Self or Mage Hand, her hand brushes against the fabric and reminds her not to steal from happy people.

Jester’s strip of Molly’s coat looks like a rainbow in old cotton. Reds, and oranges, pinks, blues, and greens twist around her left horn in a giant bow, a row of delicately embroidered moons dancing across the entire strip. Everyday she is reminded of the fortune he shared and the joy for life her fellow tiefling held within him.

Caduceus didn’t know Molly, but he knew mourning and he understood that the woman with wings of lightning and bone was mourning deeply when she left. He cut a small strip from the coat when no one was looking, bright colors with a pair of dancing swords and golden sun, and he tucked it into his gear until Yasha returned. He found a kindred spirit in Yasha during their first night on the Mistake, both eager to do as their gods commanded, but confused at the current paths of their lives. It was during this night, as the sky reached its darkest that Caduceus offered to braid her hair, incorporating the strip of fabric into the braid, so that she could keep a reminder of her friend with her always.

blog.name: lisk-art
blog.title: Lisk's Atelier
blog.description:
Stina Liskow, 25, hobby artist, illustrator and photographer.

Based in Germany.

My favorite medium to use is watercolor and I cronecly hoard watercolor papers. Right now I am into Critical Role!

.

Commissions: Open

Requests: Maybe

Trades: Maybe

Any questions? Feel free to ask ❤

Languages English and German

Fat queer of indeterminate origin.

Critical Role has taken over my life and my blog.

Taliesin Jaffe is my boyfriend.

I love you.

blog.name: dr-archeville
blog.title: Doktor Archeville's Laboratory
blog.description:
Hi!  I am a fat 40-something white introvert in NC.  I worked in the NCSU Libraries for 13 years, then was an insurance agent working with Aflac (quack!) for about 9 months, and currently work as a substitute teacher in Roxboro & a repairer/maintainer of sewing machines out of my home.
My preferred pronouns are he/him/his; my preferred nicknames are Doc or Dok, or Science Squid (or Jon).

I am a fan of... things.  So many things.
* Comics (DC Comics, Marvel Comics)
* Tabletop RPGs (Dungeons & Dragons/D&D/DnD, Eclipse Phase, GURPS, Pathfinder, Shadowrun, World of Darkness) (My OCs, my games)
* Video Games (Elder Scrolls series, Fallout series, Minecraft)
* Podcasts (Binging with Babish, Critical Role)
* Webcomics (Order of the Stick, Oglaf, SMBC, Schlock Mercenary, xkcd)
* Geek Culture /  Geek Life /  Misc. Geekery (including memes)

Basically, if it's got cosplay, fantasy, horror (esp. body horror and zombies), science (or SCIENCE!) & sci-fi, steampunk, or superheroes (or supervillains), I'll probably love it.

I also try to keep up with actual science and technology, especially body modification and transhumanism.
I also blog about libraries and library- & librarian-related things (including books), in part because I'd worked in a library for thirteen years, and about education (especially education in NC and education in America) due to my work in academic libraries and as a substitute teacher.  And about language and linguistics, as those fascinate me.
Also about jobs and job hunting, since I've been unemployed or underemployed for an uncomfortably long time, and we could all use a little help there.
I also enjoy cooking (and food), which is a type of science.  Here are some recipes I've collected.

This being the internet, I also reblog posts with cute animals.  I'm especially fond of bats.  And squid, cuttlefish, and other cephalopods. While I'm listing animals, I may as well provide a link to my cat posts.  It is the internet, so there are a lot of them.

I'm a big fan of/believer in people being themselves, and of consenting adults being able to do whatever they want however they want with whoever they want, no matter what others think.  (I.e., body positivity, sex positivity).  I try to keep this blog SFW -- the only porn I'll be posting here are food porn and technology porn -- but I do sometimes talk about sex (esp. sex education) and burlesque (there are some great burly troupes in the Triangle & Triad area).

I struggle with mild depression and anxiety issues, so sometimes my blog may get a bit maudlin.  But I also try to give advice on dealing with those, too.
-----------------------
Things I've Liked (Note: May contain some NSFW posts)
My Tumblr Crushes
My personal blargings
About Me / It Me
Getting To Know Me
My TMI Tuesday blargings
My Feels

Conventions!
* Animazement
* ConCarolinas
* ConTemporal
* Cosplay America
* Dragon*Con / Dragon Con

My Face
My Facebook
Art-related blargings
Music-related blargings
Most Fridays nights I’m at the Retro Film shows at the the Carolina Theatre in Durham.  Come join me!
